page.title: 14The Sewage works Edenbridge
page.content: The Edenbridge sewage works have been there since 1957. The land was originally used for farming. The sewage works serves the whole of Edenbridge. 1 million litres of sewage is processed on average a day. The sewage is used for fertilizer and is said to be better fertilizer than farmland manure. The clean effluent goes into River Eden. The sewage is turned into clean effluent in stages. At first it get rids of unwanted items by passing it through grids. The next stage removes the sand and grit. This is done in a channel where the sand & grit settle at the bottom. The sewage then goes into sedimentation tanks where raw sludge is removed leaving settled sewage. The nutrients and the rest of the organic material is then removed by biological filter beds. This then leaves the treated sewage or effluent.
